result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mathew Phillip Burger

records.addlTxt:
2:20 PM Defendant Mathew Phillip Burger not in court.  Attorney Jack Alan Umpleby appeared by phone for Mathew Phillip Burger.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
950/Marsy's Law complied with. 
Victim by phone and makes statement to Court.
(Court goes off record to allow Atty Umpleby to try to reach Deft)
2:49pm - Court recalls and Deft appears by phone with Atty Umpleby. DA Urmanski by phone.
Defendant waives right to an in-person hearing today. 
Preliminary Hearing Waiver on file.
Probable Cause found/Deft bound over. 
Information filed/reading waived. NG pleas entered.
State notes underlying Branch 5 case. This case will be sent to Branch 5 under Local Court Rule.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Petition for appointment of counsel, affidavit of indigency and order.  Atty Umpleby is appointed as counsel.
Defendant is to repay Sheboygan County at the rate of $25.00 per month, commencing January 01, 2023 until total sum is paid.
$100 per hour, not to exceed a total of $750 without prior approval of Court.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on September 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

11:52 AM Defendant Mathew Phillip Burger appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for the State of Wisconsin. 950/Marsy's Law complied with. Court needs victim witness code, DA will send to Judge. Deft not eligible for Public Defender, filed Court appointed paperwork for Attorney. Court- JA to work on an Attorney for Deft. Victim makes statement, would like no contact lifted. Needs to refer to victim witness office, Court extends time limits for good cause.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
